importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game, October 20, 2025, marks the conclusion of Game 6 in the ALCS, which sets the stage for the historic Game 7 between the Blue Jays and Mariners, culminating in a potential World Series matchup.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame from October 20 to 21, 2025, includes the decisive Game 7 of the ALCS, with Game 1 of the World Series scheduled for Friday, October 23, 2025, making it a pivotal period in the 2025 MLB postseason.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and forcing Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners committed three critical errors, including two in the second inning, which allowed early runs and contributed to the Blue Jays' 6-2 victory.
The Blue Jays are now set to play Game 7 for the first time since 1985, marking a significant moment in franchise history.
The Mariners will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, October 23, 2025.
Randy Arozarena’s strong performance, including a key single that ended Trey Yesavage’s outing after 87 pitches, showed resilience under pressure.
Trey Yesavage pitched a complete game, throwing a season-high 31 splitters, with only six hits and three walks, demonstrating composure and effectiveness at a high level.
The game highlights the growing competitiveness of young players like Julio Rodríguez and Isiah Kiner-Falefa, who capitalized on defensive lapses.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his sixth home run of the postseason, a pivotal moment that extended the Blue Jays' lead and directly led to the series being forced to Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The team won a decisive 6-2 game over the Mariners to force Game 7 in the ALCS, marking their first such game since 1985 and advancing them to the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners lost 6-2 and were eliminated from playoff contention after a series of defensive errors, making it their first Game 7 appearance in franchise history.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is a critical step in the MLB postseason, determining the American League champion who advances to the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The winner of the ALCS will face the Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for October 23, 2025.

namedEntities.name: Trey Yesavage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched a strong complete game, throwing a season-high 31 splitters, allowing only six hits and three walks, and ending the Mariners' rally after 87 pitches.

namedEntities.name: Randy Arozarena
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored a run on a single that knocked out Trey Yesavage and contributed to the Mariners' only run in the game.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodríguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He committed a fielding error on a ground ball, allowing a base runner to advance and contributing to early scoring by the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Eugenio Suárez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He made a critical error in a relay throw during a groundball, allowing a run to score and contributing to the Mariners' early deficit.

namedEntities.name: Isiah Kiner-Falefa
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a run-scoring single after a defensive error, helping the Blue Jays open a 2-0 lead in the second inning.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He reached second base due to a fielding error by Julio Rodríguez, initiating a run-scoring sequence.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that resulted in a fielding error by Eugenio Suárez, leading to a run scoring for the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Matt Brash
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He issued a wild pitch in the seventh inning that allowed Vladimir Guerrero Jr. to score, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 6-2.

namedEntities.name: Louis Varland
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He entered the game as a reliever and faced a run-scoring single by Eugenio Suárez, resulting in a run being scored and the Mariners scoring their only run.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a pivotal matchup of the 2025 MLB postseason, the Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the playoffs, extending the lead to 5-0 and sealing the outcome. The Mariners' loss was aided by three critical defensive errors, including two in the second inning that allowed early runs. The Blue Jays, now set to play their first Game 7 since 1985, advance to face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, October 23, 2025. Meanwhile, Mariners pitcher Trey Yesavage delivered a strong performance with a complete game, showcasing composure and control under pressure.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
